description: Join volunteers at Code for the Carolinas as we help the [National Zoning Atlas](https://www.zoningatlas.org/) (NZA) team include North Carolina and South Carolina in their nationwide zoning atlas. "The National Zoning Atlas aims to depict key aspects of zoning codes in an online, user-friendly map." The Atlas aims to provide data for better solutions in transportation, environmental, and especially affordable housing policy. This is a multi-dimensional project grounded in data science with an end-goal of contributing to a nationally influential dataset. Our current work session activities focus on internet search and integrating data from multiple sources. The project as a whole has occasional opportunities for U/X and outreach and opportunities to learn about machine learning and natural language processing through the work of the NZA team. Volunteering on this project will provide excellent exposure to the foundations of civic data science, with a focus on GIS data. Even if you're new to this project and/or civic tech volunteering, you're welcome to join the meeting. Visitors are always welcome and no technical skills are needed. You can learn more about the project on our [Slack Workspace](https://join.slack.com/t/codeforthecarolinas/shared_invite/zt-1kxuwu05x-3KxOpkOYjAuN5yuOAH8ROg) in the #project-zoning-atlas channel. Meetings start with brief introductions. New volunteers are offered a personal orientation, often in a breakout room, while experienced volunteers get right to work. By the end of the session, both groups of volunteers are working together. We also contribute to the project through asynchronous work and informal work sessions. Meetings are on the Jitsi platform and the link is provided before each meeting. If you will be joining on mobile, install the Jitsi app in advance [https://jitsi.org/downloads/](https://jitsi.org/downloads/) . Learn more at [codeforthecarolinas.org](codeforthecarolinas.org) or reach out to [masked] Meetings follow the [Open Collective Community Guidelines](https://docs.opencollective.com/help/about/the-open-collective-way/community-guidelines) as a Code of Conduct.

Networking Over Coffee, a virtual event for networking the tech community and its allies. 
The event is hosted via Zoom.

event_name: Radical Inclusion: Empowering Accessibility in Tech | WWCode Advocacy Town Hall
description:
**💫 Join the WWCode Global team and our panel of DEI experts to learn how to advocate for yourself and others on issues of accessibility for a more equitable tech industry!  💫** **🤝 About WWCode Advocacy Town Halls** 
Women Who Code Advocacy Town Halls are regular live virtual panels designed to elevate important discussions around diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) advocacy topics. These events provide technologists, founders, leaders, educators, and more access to DEI experts. Attendees can ask questions and understand how to be effective allies in fostering a more inclusive and equitable tech industry.  **🗓️ About This Event: Radical Inclusion: Empowering Accessibility in Tech**
Join us for the [Women Who Code Advocacy Town Hall](https://www.linkedin.com/events/7102027533658812417) on October 24, 2023, as we delve into "Radical Inclusion: Empowering Accessibility in Tech." This online panel discussion, [hosted on LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/events/7102027533658812417), will bring together experts and advocates to explore accessibility in the tech industry and its impact on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI). 💻 This is an online event hosted on LinkedIn. [Register now. ](https://www.linkedin.com/events/7102027533658812417) **👩🏾‍💻Who should attend:**  * Individuals with visible or invisible disabilities interested in sharing perspectives or learning about their rights.
* Team leads, hiring managers, colleagues, etc., interested in supporting and advocating for people with visual or invisible disabilities.
* Technologists looking to incorporate better accessibility practices.
* Founders or CEOs interested in creating and implementing an inclusive company culture, especially for technologists with accessibility needs. **✅ What we’ll discuss:**  * Hiring Process, Getting the Job, and Support at Work: Know the challenges and opportunities for individuals with disabilities throughout the hiring process, workplace support, and career growth.
* Visible and Invisible Disabilities: Understand and define visible and invisible disabilities and how they affect individuals in the tech industry.
* Legal Rights and Responsibilities: Learn about legal rights and responsibilities in hiring practices and actionable ways to advocate for yourself and others.
* How Allies Can Be Advocates: Explore how allies can play a role in advocating for individuals with disabilities and creating inclusive workplaces and how technologists can develop with accessibility in mind. 
* Access to Resources: Gain insights into accessibility resources and how you can find more support.  **⭐ Meet the panelists:**  * Amy Carney, Accessibility Specialist and Web Developer
* Jessica Rafuse, Director of Strategic Partnerships & Policy for Accessibility with Microsoft 
* Caterina Paun, Senior Instructor of Computer Science, Portland State University
* AmyJune Hineline (moderator), Certification Community Architect at the Linux Foundation 💻 This is an online event hosted on LinkedIn. [Register now.](https://www.linkedin.com/events/7102027533658812417) **Code of Conduct + Issue Reporting**
[Women Who Code](https://www.womenwhocode.com/) is dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community. Our events are intended to inspire women to excel in technology careers, and anyone there for this purpose is welcome. Because we value the safety and security of our members and strive to have an inclusive community, we do not tolerate harassment of members or event participants in any form. Our[ Code of Conduct](https://www.womenwhocode.com/codeofconduct) applies to all Women Who Code events. Any issues? Reach out to [[masked]](mailto:[masked]).

event_name: Develop Better Tech: Discovering UX Design & Research | WWCode Partner Event
description:
**💫 Join the WWCode Global team and our Partner Specialist Staffing Group to gain insight and confidence in understanding UX design. 💫** **🤝 About WWCode Partners and Partner Events** 
Women Who Code Partners are organizations that work with us to provide opportunities and educational content to help empower you to excel in your technology career. Our Partners are passionate about supporting a more equitable and diverse industry. Join these events for great content from technology leaders and to hear about opportunities to work with our Partners.  **🗓️ About This Event: Develop Better  Technology:  Discovering UX  Design & Research with Specialist Staffing Group** 
Have you ever wondered how UX design and research shape the technology we use daily? How we interact with and adopt new technology is influenced by the decisions of UX designers/researchers and their understanding of what people need for technology to be useful. However, if designers/researchers don’t consider user needs when developing tech, even great technology can fail to be adopted and become mainstream. Join WWCode Partner Specialist Staffing Group and our expert panel of technologists from across the tech industry to gain insight and confidence into understanding UX design. The speakers will share their professional path to UX design and research, what UX problems they are working to solve, and discuss the importance of diversity in UX design. *Why you should attend:* * Learn from experienced technologists how to approach UX in your development process with research and diversity in mind. 
* Connect and network with other members of the WWCode community.
* Get exposure to opportunities to work with the Specialist Staffing Group.  *Meet the speakers:*  * Haley Dean; Senior Recruitment Consultant, Computer Futures
* Jen Blatz; Principal UX Researcher, BECU
* Adrienne Guillory, MBA; Chief Operating Officer, Usability Sciences Corporation
* Manu Kaligotla; Sr. Manager, Design Research, Abercrombie & Fitch Co. **💻 This is an online event. [Register now.](https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/5716959225248/WN_vHIsxfMSTkKWz4B9tKBGqw#/registration)** \*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* **🔍 See More Opportunities from Our Partners**  * [Scholarships & Ticket Giveaways ](https://www.womenwhocode.com/opportunities)
* [Jobs ](https://www.womenwhocode.com/jobs)
* [Share Your Resume with Hiring Partners ](https://wwcode.typeform.com/to/reyEuv?) \*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*
**Code of Conduct + Issue Reporting**
[Women Who Code](https://www.womenwhocode.com/) is dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community. Our events are intended to inspire women to excel in technology careers, and anyone who is there for this purpose is welcome. Because we value the safety and security of our members and strive to have an inclusive community, we do not tolerate harassment of members or event participants in any form. Our[ Code of Conduct](https://www.womenwhocode.com/codeofconduct) applies to all Women Who Code events. Any issues? Reach out to [[masked]](mailto:[masked]).

event_name: Civic Tech Volunteer Coffee Break (online, drop-in)
description: Are you curious about civic tech volunteering? Drop in for a few minutes or the full hour to learn about civic tech and how we make a difference in our communities. Learn about our current projects and our online-first hybrid model making this movement available to all communities the Carolinas. Our current projects relate to housing, pedestrian accessibility, affordable broadband, and open government. If you are involved with a non-profit or community organization, you're also welcome to stop by to discuss [partnership opportunities](https://codeforthecarolinas.org/?page_id=34) with our civic tech volunteers. Visitors are always welcome and no technical skills are needed. Meetings are on the Jitsi platform and the link is provided before each meeting. If you will be joining on mobile, install the Jitsi app in advance [https://jitsi.org/downloads/](https://jitsi.org/downloads/) Learn more at [codeforthecarolinas.org](codeforthecarolinas.org) , [join our Slack workspace](https://join.slack.com/t/codeforthecarolinas/shared_invite/zt-1kxuwu05x-3KxOpkOYjAuN5yuOAH8ROg), or reach out to [masked] Meetings and all of our online spaces adopt the [Open Collective Community Guidelines as a Code of Conduct](https://docs.opencollective.com/help/about/the-open-collective-way/community-guidelines).

Join us to talk about programming and tech. Bring your projects or studies to ask for help. Share a favorite technical paper, book, talk, or tweet, or just kick back with some kindred spirits in a friendly social setting. This meeting will be in person at Blue Ridge Brewing Company in Greer. Note change in day of the week to Wednesday, and start time a 7:00pm to better fit schedules.

Did you make something and want to show it off?
Here's your chance! We'd love to see what you've been up to.
Bring your project!
Do you need assistance in making something?
Bring your questions! We're looking for the best makers, inventors, creators!
We'll be accepting new member applications so if you want to get in on what we have going on, now is the time! Come see some cool tool demonstrations and learn about our new upcoming classes and activities we have planned. If you have become a new member recently, come meet the awesome people in the community. Bring a friend, come see some cool projects in process, meet some cool makers. Also, there will be pizza and new members will receive a free gift.

\*\*\* If this session fills up or you can't get here this weekend, we will consider opening another workshop next week on Saturday Nov 4th, please let us know! \*\*\* **Want to find out if you like welding?** Here's your chance with a workshop geared for people who have never welded before or those needing a refresher. Kyle Varnadore, one of our resident welding experts, teaches a hands-on MIG welding workshop. He will be covering welding safety, several types of welding processes, and will guide you through making a welded pen holder or other art. SynergyMill will provide all of the safety gear, welding equipment, and materials. Eye protection is mandatory, masks are optional. Please wear closed-toe shoes and jeans. The fee for this workshop is $95 to cover materials and equipment and you can keep the project you make! Refunds are available 1 week prior to class, or if it's your choice, we will hold your spot for the next class. A signed liability waiver is required: https://bit.ly/35NPzry 18+, minors may attend if accompanied by a responsible adult. Membership is not required to take this course, however, it is a prerequisite for the TIG class and to use the welding gear at SynergyMill. Come learn about welding and stay for pizza (or practice welding!) You can pay your $95 class fee here: http://bit.ly/41w1Pc9
Security BSides returns bigger, better and more exciting to Greenville in 2023!!!

event_name: Open Sidewalks Work Session / "Remote Mapping Party"
description: Join other civic tech volunteers from across the Carolinas for a Remote Mapping Party for our Open Sidewalks project. At these bi-weekly sessions, Code for the Carolinas volunteers work together to complete our project of mapping pedestrian access features in Downtown Raleigh. The area we are mapping is an important hub for public transit, state government, and recreation. This project is a partnership with the [Taskar Center for Accessible Technology at the University of Washington](https://tcat.cs.washington.edu/). The project involves using aerial imagery to code maps and metadata about features that make streets accessible to pedestrians--especially features that are important for pedestrians who face barriers to mobility and use wheelchairs or walkers. Even if you're new to this project and/or civic tech volunteering, you're welcome to join the meeting. Visitors are always welcome and no technical skills are needed. You can find information about the project, including orientation videos from the Taskar Center, [in our Slack Workspace](https://join.slack.com/t/codeforthecarolinas/shared_invite/zt-1kxuwu05x-3KxOpkOYjAuN5yuOAH8ROg) in the #project-open-sidewalks channel. You can also learn more at [codeforthecarolinas.org](codeforthecarolinas.org) or reach out to [masked] Meetings are on the Jitsi platform and the link is provided before each meeting. If you will be joining on mobile, install the Jitsi app in advance [https://jitsi.org/downloads/](https://jitsi.org/downloads/) . Meetings follow the [Open Collective Community Guidelines](https://docs.opencollective.com/help/about/the-open-collective-way/community-guidelines) as a Code of Conduct.
Live from Greenville, presenters will lift the hood on their tech stack and talk about discoveries, insights, and challenges they overcame.

event_name: Welcome to Our Civic Tech Volunteer Meeting!
description:
Code for the Carolinas is a community of people working together as civic tech volunteers to improve wellbeing in North and South Carolina, and we invite you to join us for our biweekly online meetings! Our meetings start with introductions, updates on old and new business, and status reports on current projects, emphasizing how you can get involved. All are welcome and no technical skills are needed. **Typical Agenda**
Introductions
Organizational Updates
Project updates * Active projects, like Zoning Atlas and Open Sidewalks
* Proposal development, like Affordable Connectivity Program Meetings are on the Jitsi platform and the link is provided before each meeting. If you will be joining on mobile, install the Jitsi app in advance [https://jitsi.org/downloads/](https://jitsi.org/downloads/) If you joined on mobile and your audio isn't working, it might be because you joined through a browser and not through the app. Learn more at [codeforthecarolinas.org](codeforthecarolinas.org), [join our Slack](https://join.slack.com/t/codeforthecarolinas/shared_invite/zt-1kxuwu05x-3KxOpkOYjAuN5yuOAH8ROg), or reach out to [masked] Meetings follow the [Open Collective Community Guidelines](https://docs.opencollective.com/help/about/the-open-collective-way/community-guidelines) as a Code of Conduct.

venue.name: Greenville County Library System | Hughes Main Library

description:
Join us for the monthly DEF CON 864 group meeting online and in-person. * In-person at Hughes Main Library meeting room A
* Online details are posted in our Discord.
* Discord invite is on our website at dc864.org. All meetings are free and open to the public. We have a very open format, so join in and let us know what your interests are that you'd like to see from this group. We leave an hour to going over member projects and interests. Have a Raspberry Pi project or build a custom drone? Bring it in and show us how you did it. Creating your own set of scripts for system reconnaissance? We'd love to see it.

event_name: Leveraging Community Coding Experience to Enhance Your Resume
description:
**✨ Join WWCode Global to learn how to showcase your coding experience in your professional portfolio and resume to help you excel in your tech career! [Register now](https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_6m1TGZFoQmqxCcWimyS0Iw#/registration) for this online event.**  Join WWCode Global in our special session on November 8, 2023. This session will empower you to turn your coding passion into professional experience on your resume to help you impress hiring managers in tech. Learn to make your Hackathon adventures, Open Source dives, and volunteer coding moments really stand out! It's not just about simply listing them — it's about quantifying them. We'll delve into effective techniques to transform these non-traditional experiences into tangible, resume-boosting metrics. Effectively communicating your experience makes a difference! **Stick around after our chat, and you'll get the chance to sign up for the upcoming WWCode Hackathon. This is your chance to put your new knowledge into action!**  **✅ Why you should join:**  * Learn to showcase your coding experience as skills for your portfolio and resume. 
* Connect with other coders and build your network of technologists. 
* Get a preview of more opportunities to get involved with the coding community.  **Code of Conduct + Issue Reporting**
[Women Who Code](https://www.womenwhocode.com/) is dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community. Our events are intended to inspire women to excel in technology careers, and anyone there for this purpose is welcome. Because we value the safety and security of our members and strive to have an inclusive community, we do not tolerate harassment of members or event participants in any form. Our[ Code of Conduct](https://www.womenwhocode.com/codeofconduct) applies to all Women Who Code events. Any issues? Reach out to [[masked]](mailto:[masked]).

Join us to talk about programming and tech. Bring your projects or studies to ask for help. Share a favorite technical paper, book, talk, or tweet, or just kick back with some kindred spirits in a friendly social setting. This meeting will be in person at Blue Ridge Brewing Company in Greer. Note change in day of the week to Wednesday, and start time a 7:00pm to better fit schedules.

Sometimes it's fun to get together and work on projects with friends. Maybe there's a bug in your open source project and you want help fixing it up, maybe you want to kick around some ideas for new projects or maybe you just want to chat about recent developments in technology and the Python programming language.. Coffee and Code is where we get together to hang out and work on projects that we care about. No script, no slide decks, just coffee and code.

Please join us for our regular monthly meetup. Running Order (Subject to Change):
11:30 am: Arrive for networking and refreshments
11:45 am - Opening remarks
12 pm - Speaker
12:40 pm - Open Q&A Session
12:50 pm - Closing remarks & Social
1:00 pm - End ******Anyone that comes to the MeetUp gets 3 MONTH FREE HOSTING of the Swift Hosting plan from our sponsor A2HOSTING.COM (https://www.a2hosting.com/web-hosting)****** Come prepared to listen to a great talk!!! Important to know:
We use the same Code of Conduct for our Meetup that we use for WordCamp Greenville, and it can be found here: https://2020.greenville.wordcamp.org/code-of-conduct/ Please be kind and courteous to all attendees and employees!

group_name: Beer and Napkins Communities of Design
description: Are you feeling dizzy trying to navigate the accelerating changes as an artist or creative? We understand that it can be challenging, so we at Beer and Napkins are excited to announce our ongoing community for Creatives. This community is designed to facilitate knowledge sharing, provide tips and techniques, explore technology, and discuss community development ideas. We invite you to join us for our Bi-Monthly Meetup at Carolina Bauernhaus in Greenville at 6:30 PM. This is a fantastic opportunity to connect with like-minded creatives and engage in supportive conversations to help you grow and thrive as an artist and creator. Don't miss this fantastic opportunity to expand your network, learn new skills, and share your experiences with other creatives. We hope to see you there!

The area we are mapping is an important hub for public transit, state government, and recreation. This project is a partnership with the [Taskar Center for Accessible Technology at the University of Washington](https://tcat.cs.washington.edu/). The project involves using aerial imagery to code maps and metadata about features that make streets accessible to pedestrians--especially features that are important for pedestrians who face barriers to mobility and use wheelchairs or walkers. Even if you're new to this project and/or civic tech volunteering, you're welcome to join the meeting. Visitors are always welcome and no technical skills are needed. You can find information about the project, including orientation videos from the Taskar Center, [in our Slack Workspace](https://join.slack.com/t/codeforthecarolinas/shared_invite/zt-1kxuwu05x-3KxOpkOYjAuN5yuOAH8ROg) in the #project-open-sidewalks channel. You can also learn more at [codeforthecarolinas.org](codeforthecarolinas.org) or reach out to [masked] Meetings are on the Jitsi platform and the link is provided before each meeting. If you will be joining on mobile, install the Jitsi app in advance [https://jitsi.org/downloads/](https://jitsi.org/downloads/) . Meetings follow the [Open Collective Community Guidelines](https://docs.opencollective.com/help/about/the-open-collective-way/community-guidelines) as a Code of Conduct.

event_name: 💝 Join Us for GivingTuesday and Empower Women Who Code
description:
**💝 Be a part of the Women Who Code mission to transform lives and communities by making tech a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive space for women and underserved technologists! Join us on GivingTuesday on November 28 to empower diverse women to excel in technology careers.** 📅 RSVP to remember to give on November 28! ⭐ **Why Give?**
As a global nonprofit organization, we provide technical and career resources, programs, and events completely free to our 360,000 members in 147 countries. We're committed to creating a tech industry where historically excluded individuals thrive at every level. Your donation makes a difference. **⭐ Your Donation Empowers**
Your support enables us to empower women and non-binary technologists, providing them with the full support they need to thrive in tech, through: * **Coding Resources:** Access to free live technical workshops and study groups, on-demand coding tutorials, podcasts, Coding Buddy programs, Hackathons, and more.
* **Leadership Training:** Opportunities to develop leadership skills through volunteering, public speaking, event management, and hands-on leadership workshops.
* **Mentorship:** Connection with experienced technology and career professionals and educators, as well as the opportunity to become a mentor and give back.
* **Networking:** Valuable connections with our global community of technologists and industry Partners who seek to mentor and hire our diverse members.
* **Job Opportunities:** Access to the WWCode Job Board, tailored Member Experience with Career Navigation programs, and resources to open professional doors for technologists.
* **Scholarships:** Critical funds to help technologists access boot camps, learning materials, technical conferences, and more. When you give, you help women stay in technology, increasing their lifetime earnings and enhancing their career prospects. Your gift has the power to uplift diverse women and their families, contributing to a more equitable tech industry. 📅 RSVP to remember to give on November 28! Your donation, no matter the amount, fuels our mission to create lasting change. Together, we empower, and together, we thrive. Thank you for being part of our global movement to make technology a place where everyone can excel. **⭐ Your Donation Changes the Lives of Women in Tech** *“I would like to express my gratitude since this is a truly amazing opportunity that will have a great and positive impact on my career. It will allow me to develop all the skills I have been searching for in order to change my career. I cannot thank WWCode team and the organizers of the MITxPro enough for offering this opportunity to the WWCODE community. It will definitely change my life.” – WWCode Scholarship Recipient* *“Women Who Code has been an instrumental force in shaping my career path. Through the empowering network, I've connected with inspiring women in tech who've shared invaluable insights and mentorship. This support has fueled my drive to excel in the tech industry. Being part of Women Who Code has expanded my horizons, boosted my confidence, and opened doors to opportunities I might not have encountered otherwise. It's a catalyst for change, fostering an environment where women's contributions are celebrated and amplified – a mission that deeply resonates with my own aspirations and journey.” – WWCode Scholarship Recipient*

event_name: Welcome to Our Civic Tech Volunteer Meeting!
description:
Code for the Carolinas is a community of people working together as civic tech volunteers to improve wellbeing in North and South Carolina, and we invite you to join us for our biweekly online meetings! Our meetings start with introductions, updates on old and new business, and status reports on current projects, emphasizing how you can get involved. All are welcome and no technical skills are needed. **Typical Agenda**
Introductions
Organizational Updates
Project updates * Active projects, like Zoning Atlas and Open Sidewalks
* Proposal development, like Affordable Connectivity Program Meetings are on the Jitsi platform and the link is provided before each meeting. If you will be joining on mobile, install the Jitsi app in advance [https://jitsi.org/downloads/](https://jitsi.org/downloads/) If you joined on mobile and your audio isn't working, it might be because you joined through a browser and not through the app. Learn more at [codeforthecarolinas.org](codeforthecarolinas.org), [join our Slack](https://join.slack.com/t/codeforthecarolinas/shared_invite/zt-1kxuwu05x-3KxOpkOYjAuN5yuOAH8ROg), or reach out to [masked] Meetings follow the [Open Collective Community Guidelines](https://docs.opencollective.com/help/about/the-open-collective-way/community-guidelines) as a Code of Conduct.

Join volunteers at Code for the Carolinas as we help the [National Zoning Atlas](https://www.zoningatlas.org/) (NZA) team include North Carolina and South Carolina in their nationwide zoning atlas. "The National Zoning Atlas aims to depict key aspects of zoning codes in an online, user-friendly map." The Atlas aims to provide data for better solutions in transportation, environmental, and especially affordable housing policy. This is a multi-dimensional project grounded in data science with an end-goal of contributing to a nationally influential dataset. Our current work session activities focus on internet search and integrating data from multiple sources. The project as a whole has occasional opportunities for U/X and outreach and opportunities to learn about machine learning and natural language processing through the work of the NZA team. Volunteering on this project will provide excellent exposure to the foundations of civic data science, with a focus on GIS data. Even if you're new to this project and/or civic tech volunteering, you're welcome to join the meeting. Visitors are always welcome and no technical skills are needed. You can learn more about the project on our [Slack Workspace](https://join.slack.com/t/codeforthecarolinas/shared_invite/zt-1kxuwu05x-3KxOpkOYjAuN5yuOAH8ROg) in the #project-zoning-atlas channel. Meetings start with brief introductions. New volunteers are offered a personal orientation, often in a breakout room, while experienced volunteers get right to work. By the end of the session, both groups of volunteers are working together. We also contribute to the project through asynchronous work and informal work sessions. Meetings are on the Jitsi platform and the link is provided before each meeting. If you will be joining on mobile, install the Jitsi app in advance [https://jitsi.org/downloads/](https://jitsi.org/downloads/) . Learn more at [codeforthecarolinas.org](codeforthecarolinas.org) or reach out to [masked] Meetings follow the [Open Collective Community Guidelines](https://docs.opencollective.com/help/about/the-open-collective-way/community-guidelines) as a Code of Conduct.

event_name: Civic Tech Volunteer Coffee Break (online, drop-in)
description: Are you curious about civic tech volunteering? Drop in for a few minutes or the full hour to learn about civic tech and how we make a difference in our communities. Learn about our current projects and our online-first hybrid model making this movement available to all communities the Carolinas. Our current projects relate to housing, pedestrian accessibility, affordable broadband, and open government. If you are involved with a non-profit or community organization, you're also welcome to stop by to discuss [partnership opportunities](https://codeforthecarolinas.org/?page_id=34) with our civic tech volunteers. Visitors are always welcome and no technical skills are needed. Meetings are on the Jitsi platform and the link is provided before each meeting. If you will be joining on mobile, install the Jitsi app in advance [https://jitsi.org/downloads/](https://jitsi.org/downloads/) Learn more at [codeforthecarolinas.org](codeforthecarolinas.org) , [join our Slack workspace](https://join.slack.com/t/codeforthecarolinas/shared_invite/zt-1kxuwu05x-3KxOpkOYjAuN5yuOAH8ROg), or reach out to [masked] Meetings and all of our online spaces adopt the [Open Collective Community Guidelines as a Code of Conduct](https://docs.opencollective.com/help/about/the-open-collective-way/community-guidelines).

Join us to talk about programming and tech. Bring your projects or studies to ask for help. Share a favorite technical paper, book, talk, or tweet, or just kick back with some kindred spirits in a friendly social setting. This meeting will be in person at Blue Ridge Brewing Company in Greer. Note change in day of the week to Wednesday, and start time a 7:00pm to better fit schedules.

venue.name: Greenville County Library System | Hughes Main Library

description:
Join us for the monthly DEF CON 864 group meeting online and in-person. * In-person at Hughes Main Library meeting room A
* Online details are posted in our Discord.
* Discord invite is on our website at dc864.org. All meetings are free and open to the public. We have a very open format, so join in and let us know what your interests are that you'd like to see from this group. We leave an hour to going over member projects and interests. Have a Raspberry Pi project or build a custom drone? Bring it in and show us how you did it. Creating your own set of scripts for system reconnaissance? We'd love to see it.

Sometimes it's fun to get together and work on projects with friends. Maybe there's a bug in your open source project and you want help fixing it up, maybe you want to kick around some ideas for new projects or maybe you just want to chat about recent developments in technology and the Python programming language.. Coffee and Code is where we get together to hang out and work on projects that we care about. No script, no slide decks, just coffee and code.
Connect with small business owners, startups, investors and community leaders.

event_name: Open Sidewalks Work Session / "Remote Mapping Party"
description: Join other civic tech volunteers from across the Carolinas for a Remote Mapping Party for our Open Sidewalks project. At these bi-weekly sessions, Code for the Carolinas volunteers work together to complete our project of mapping pedestrian access features in Downtown Raleigh. The area we are mapping is an important hub for public transit, state government, and recreation. This project is a partnership with the [Taskar Center for Accessible Technology at the University of Washington](https://tcat.cs.washington.edu/). The project involves using aerial imagery to code maps and metadata about features that make streets accessible to pedestrians--especially features that are important for pedestrians who face barriers to mobility and use wheelchairs or walkers. Even if you're new to this project and/or civic tech volunteering, you're welcome to join the meeting. Visitors are always welcome and no technical skills are needed. You can find information about the project, including orientation videos from the Taskar Center, [in our Slack Workspace](https://join.slack.com/t/codeforthecarolinas/shared_invite/zt-1kxuwu05x-3KxOpkOYjAuN5yuOAH8ROg) in the #project-open-sidewalks channel. You can also learn more at [codeforthecarolinas.org](codeforthecarolinas.org) or reach out to [masked] Meetings are on the Jitsi platform and the link is provided before each meeting. If you will be joining on mobile, install the Jitsi app in advance [https://jitsi.org/downloads/](https://jitsi.org/downloads/) . Meetings follow the [Open Collective Community Guidelines](https://docs.opencollective.com/help/about/the-open-collective-way/community-guidelines) as a Code of Conduct.

Please join us for our regular monthly meetup. Running Order (Subject to Change):
11:30 am: Arrive for networking and refreshments
11:45 am - Opening remarks
12 pm - Speaker
12:40 pm - Open Q&A Session
12:50 pm - Closing remarks & Social
1:00 pm - End ******Anyone that comes to the MeetUp gets 3 MONTH FREE HOSTING of the Swift Hosting plan from our sponsor A2HOSTING.COM (https://www.a2hosting.com/web-hosting)****** Come prepared to listen to a great talk!!! Important to know:
We use the same Code of Conduct for our Meetup that we use for WordCamp Greenville, and it can be found here: https://2020.greenville.wordcamp.org/code-of-conduct/ Please be kind and courteous to all attendees and employees!

group_name: Beer and Napkins Communities of Design
description: Are you feeling dizzy trying to navigate the accelerating changes as an artist or creative? We understand that it can be challenging, so we at Beer and Napkins are excited to announce our ongoing community for Creatives. This community is designed to facilitate knowledge sharing, provide tips and techniques, explore technology, and discuss community development ideas. We invite you to join us for our Bi-Monthly Meetup at Carolina Bauernhaus in Greenville at 6:30 PM. This is a fantastic opportunity to connect with like-minded creatives and engage in supportive conversations to help you grow and thrive as an artist and creator. Don't miss this fantastic opportunity to expand your network, learn new skills, and share your experiences with other creatives. We hope to see you there!

Join us to talk about programming and tech. Bring your projects or studies to ask for help. Share a favorite technical paper, book, talk, or tweet, or just kick back with some kindred spirits in a friendly social setting. This meeting will be in person at Blue Ridge Brewing Company in Greer. Note change in day of the week to Wednesday, and start time a 7:00pm to better fit schedules.

description: Are you feeling dizzy trying to navigate the accelerating changes as an artist or creative? This community is designed to facilitate knowledge sharing, provide tips and techniques, explore technology, and discuss community development ideas. description:

We have a very open format, so join in and let us know what your interests are that you'd like to see from this group. We leave an hour to going over member projects and interests. Have a Raspberry Pi project or build a custom drone? Bring it in and show us how you did it. Creating your own set of scripts for system reconnaissance? We'd love to see it.

Sometimes it's fun to get together and work on projects with friends. Maybe there's a bug in your open source project and you want help fixing it up, maybe you want to kick around some ideas for new projects or maybe you just want to chat about recent developments in technology and the Python programming language.. Coffee and Code is where we get together to hang out and work on projects that we care about. No script, no slide decks, just coffee and code.
